description:
Conservators and conservation scientists examine artworks with advanced tools like digital microscopes to assess an object's condition and understand how, where, and when it was made in preparation for care and restoration. Join museum textile conservator Isaac Facio for a drop-in experience in close looking and use microscopes to explore the many secrets embedded in the microstructures of textiles.


About the Conservator

Isaac Facio focuses on the care, preservation, and exhibition of objects as associate conservator for textiles at the Art Institute of Chicago. He maintains a research-based practice in art and science with an emphasis on technology and 3D woven structures, and is senior lecturer in fiber and material studies at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago. Isaac received training in textiles, textiles conservation, studio art, material science and technology in Chicago, Manchester, England, and Paris, France.

This program is based upon work supported by the National Science Foundation under Grant No. OISE 1743748.
